editionStmt.p: The initial version of this file was created from data kindly provided by the Ethiopic Manuscript Imaging Project directed by Steve Delamarter.

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens und Eritreas: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / Beta maṣāḥǝft

licence.p: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msContents.summary: F-4v: Excerpt from Sword of Divinity, Säyfä Mäläkot, ሠይፈ፡ መለኮት፡, AbbCat 171, , Notice 104; AbbCat 186, , Notice 233; StrLin 47, f.88v; EMML 1169, , EMIP 33:10, 2043/Tweed 94. Scribe is mentioned on ., Walda Giyorgis. : note in a secondary hand, a curse on one who steals or damages the book. F-45v: Canticle of the flower, Maḫletä Ṣǝge, ማሕሌተ፡ ጽጌ፡. Grohmann, Marienhymnen, 46–321; Osvaldo Raineri, Codices Comboniani Aethiopici (Vatican City, 2000) 108f., no. 103; Täsfa Gäbrä Śǝlasse, ማሕሌተ፡ ጽጌ፡ወሰቆቃወ፡ ድንግል። (Addis Ababa, 1964 A. M. = 1971/2). See also Fessehation Andemariam, “Mariology in the ‘Mahleta Sege’: Abba Giyorgis Gassičča’s ‘Hymn of the Flower,’” MA Thesis, Salesian Pontifical University (Rome, 1994). -72v : Wisest of the Wise, Ṭäbibä Ṭäbiban, ጠቢበ፡ ጠቢባን፡. DChr 108–31; MG 118–63. Répertoire 364. mentions the scribe, ተክለ ወልድ

origin.origDate: f. 45v mentions Abuna Matewos and Emperor Menilek

revisionDesc.change: Created XML record from EMIP Collection Metadata.xsls
